issue.title: OAuth integration
issue.body:
It'd be nice to have GitHub's [OAuth](https://developer.github.com/guides/basics-of-authentication/) used for generating access tokens instead of requiring intervention on the user's part.

The Chrome extension documentation has [an example](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/tut_oauth) that looks like it should be helpful in accomplishing this.

issue.title: Call to non-existent function on profile pages
issue.body:
Must have slipped my brain while adding error handling...

https://github.com/jay-khatri/GitStub/blob/master/data_col.js#L27

issue.title: Add error handling
issue.body:
The only error handling right now is [a lonely log message](https://github.com/jay-khatri/GitStub/blob/master/data_col.js#L135).  The extension should of course handle all errors, but at a minimum:
- [x] Handle blank/invalid GitHub auth token and point user to settings page
- [x] Handle failed XMLHttpRequest and show user a message

issue.title: Gists should be ignored for now
issue.body: The extension as configured right now will match gist URLs, but the resulting XHR fails.  Gist recommendation might be a possible feature, but they should be ignored for now.

issue.title: Gists should be ignored for now
issue.body: The extension as configured right now will match gist URLs, but the resulting XHR fails.  Gist recommendation might be a possible feature, but they should be ignored for now.

issue.title: Current repository shows up in recommendations
issue.body:
As is, the current repository will sometimes show up in the list of recommendations.  

Examples:
- [samshadwell/TrumpScript](https://github.com/samshadwell/TrumpScript)
- [crobi/rpg-cards](https://github.com/crobi/rpg-cards)

I think this has to do with contributors who star their own repositories.

issue.title: Error Loading Extension
issue.body:
```
Failed to load extension from: ~/temp/GitStub/Hack-Rice
Could not load javascript 'd3.min.js' for content script.
```

Trying on  Chrome 53.0.2785.143 on Mac El Captian.

Love the idea, definitely want to get it working.
